website_summaries.verdict: If you are considering an electric-powered pottery wheel and don't mind the high price tag, this model has features and capabilities that impress.
pros: Fast, smooth, and efficient, thanks to the burshless motor that's powered by 110 volts of electricity
Easy to switch from forward to reverse
cons: Expensive compared to other models we considered
Some artists prefer the experience of working with a traditional wheel

customer_reviews.title: Nice value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great starter! My son really likes it. He will graduate from college this year becoming an art teacher and was impressed for his first personal wheel. Runs smooth sturdy and easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after one use
customer_reviews.text: Used this item once and it stopped working. I did not want to give any stars and it did not merit one but this site made me.
customer_reviews.author: tracy

customer_reviews.title: Not new
customer_reviews.text: It’s was clearly used before we received it. It was completely dirty. Returned!
customer_reviews.author: Kgar

customer_reviews.title: Product damaged
customer_reviews.text: The turn dial for the forward and reverse was broken in half. Also when i went to put the legs on one of the nuts came off the wheel because the tack weld didn’t hold. The box was even damaged when it was dropped off.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great buy good value fun factor priceless 👍
customer_reviews.text: You are going to have so much fun throwing on this wheel !! Great for beginners !! Made well easy to clean !! Good value for money !! The wheel speed is not to fast an i love you can control the foot pedal easily !! Geat value
customer_reviews.author: Aj  strong

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift, turned on once, used and table was wobbly, not sturdy enough. Device wouldn’t turn on again after first use. First bad purchase from Amazon, what a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: No bat pins
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY reason I gave it a 4 is because it did not have any bat pins (didn't realize this when I purchased), but it works great and fairly easy to clean despite not being able to remove basin. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Pickering

customer_reviews.title: Quality buy for the the price!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very new to throwing but I love this pottery wheel. It’s definitely worth the money but my only complaint is that I wish the plate would unattached from the base ( I don’t know if that’s even possible). I just think it would make cleaning it so much easier especially after you’ve finished a piece.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great little wheel
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this little machine! I have used it every day the last two weeks and is working great, fingers crossed it lasts a long time. I love it! It’s pretty small so would recommend for someone shorter then 6ft. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: The schiel’s

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I love it except the spinning part is to slick, clay likes to fly off the wheel
customer_reviews.author: l Brand

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this potters wheel while I was taking classes at a local studio. I wanted to be able to practice at home. This wheel is completely adequate for the beginning potter. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: patty

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought for wife since we are isolated from shops & studios. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Sodapop

customer_reviews.title: Great machine so far
customer_reviews.text: We haven’t used it that much yet but it’s well built and seems to work great for us.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: It's good
customer_reviews.text: Naturally, it doesn't have the plates to go on the spinning table. But the 350 watt motor delivers pretty good. It spins a little more slowly than the same looking model with the 250 watt motor does but it has more torque, meaning it doesn't get bogged down as easily. The pedal is very responsive. It would also benefit from having a base to put it on. I'll probably make a base similar to what I saw on YouTube. If it had plates I'd give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: For being a cheap Chinese item it is actually well built. The side are metal, the motor has decent power and the foot pedal is responsive. I wish the spinning table part came off but for the price i can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Post office lost it for a while. I know have it and it is great
customer_reviews.author: Vincent G Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the $
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s a great starter wheel for the price. I use mine daily and it works great. It runs smoothly and is quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: POS... Horrible product.
customer_reviews.text: POS worked great for about a 3weeks then began slowing down and speeding up on its own while I was working which basically made it unusable. Spend the money for a good wheel and don't be fooled by this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C Whitmore

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product from a horrible seller
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy, motor is weak, deeper grooves where there should be none make it difficult to clean, AND, to TOP IT OFF, during the age of COVID-19, the seller has INCREASED the price. Shame on you, and shame on those that support this unethical, immoral practice.
customer_reviews.author: MWM

customer_reviews.title: Motor slows when throwing
customer_reviews.text: I need to replace this product the wheel slows down as soon as I try and throw a pot. This should not happen. please tell me how to return it because the button to return won't let me.
customer_reviews.author: teddyrobson

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it's a good wheel for beginners or those looking to throw small stuff.
customer_reviews.text: The first time turning the wheel on, it sounded like something was hitting something somewhere. We couldn't see where it was coming from. We decided to use it. Noise still there and loud enough to cause throwing to be off. But its a $150 wheel. What should I expect? It to work perfectly?
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

product_meta.title: YaeTek 25CM 350W Electric Pottery Wheel Machine Ceramic Work Clay Forming Machine DIY Art Craft Tool 110V US Plug
product_meta.description:
- Color: Orange

- Wheel Diameter: 25cm/9.84''

- Rated Voltage: AC 220V/AC 110V

- Power: 250-350W

- Speed: 0-300r/min inorganic speed

- Forward and Reverse direction of rotation: 500x400x450mm

- Noise: <60db

- The motor: Advanced brushless motor

- Material: Metal + Aluminum Alloy

- Size: Approx. 42 x 52 x 35cm/16.54 x 20.47 x 13.78''

Warm Notice: dear customers, your satisfaction is our top concern, if you receive any defective items, please feel free to contact us, we offer 30days return policy. Thanks much!
feature_bullets: - Elegant appearance, with compact structure, small footprint, good mud blocking (prevent mixing chaos rejection);
- Adjustable Speed, Low noise; Forward and Reverse Rotation Optional, etc.
- This pottery wheel machine is developed based on the requirements of professional pottery, children's ceramic teaching, urban entertainment pottery etc;
- With Single-phase, three-wire access leakage protection, ensures you a safe and reliable operation.

- Application: widely used in school teaching,pottery bar, or at home use, satisfying the needs of the majority of professionals,amateur ceramic enthusiasts and the development of design Pottery special equipment.
